revised_title: Observations of the Transit of Venus in 1761
tldr: Monsieur De la Lande and M. Chappe observed the transit of Venus on June 6, 1761, in Tobolsk, Siberia. They used a refracting telescope and a micrometer to measure the distance between the southern limb of Venus and the sun's nearest limb, finding it to be 6.2 arcseconds. They also determined the sun's diameter to be 31.37 arcminutes.
